intro: Omphalodes icumae, commonly known as the Caucasian omphalodes, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, also known as the carrot or parsley family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its small, white to pinkish flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Omphalodes icumae is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
